body:
I've investigated this but it is pretty hard to follow.

For some reason the url change event is fired multiple times, one of those
while the url is empty and that's why it fails to parse the page number.

If anyone has a good understanding of the specificities of angular on IE I
could definitely use some help debugging.

On Fri, Aug 14, 2015 at 11:49 AM, Andre Steingress <notifications@github.com
> wrote:

> Happens in IE 10 too. When clicking the > arrow for the first time,
> $routeParams.pageNumber at some point contains a String instead of the
> page number from the URI, so the page number becomes NaN and thing start
> to fall apart.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/12084#issuecomment-131070998>.
>
